description: Borrowed from Latin delictum (“fault”), from neuter of delictus, past participle of delinquo (“to be lacking; to fail; to transgress”), from dē- + linquō (“to leave, quit, forsake, depart from”).

entries.meaning: (civil law, Scots law) A wrongful act, analogous to a tort in common law. [from the early 16th c.]
(law) The branch of law dealing in delicts.
